name: Brahmin (Bahun)
description: Hill Brahmins, traditionally priests and scholars

name: Chhetri
description: Kshatriya/warrior caste, most populous group in Nepal

name: Thakuri
description: Royal and aristocratic families among Khas-Arya

name: Sanyasi/Dashnami
description: Renunciate and ascetic groups

name: Hill Janajati
description: Indigenous hill groups like Magar, Gurung, Tamang, Rai, Limbu, etc.

name: Tarai Janajati
description: Indigenous Terai groups like Tharu, Rajbanshi, Dhimal, etc.

name: Madhesi High Caste
description: Maithil Brahmin, Kayastha, Rajput, Bhumihar, etc.

name: Madhesi Middle Caste
description: Yadav, Kurmi, Teli, Kalwar, Kanu, etc.

name: Madhesi Dalit
description: Terai Dalit communities (included in Madhesi category in some contexts)

name: Hill Dalit
description: Kami, Damai, Sarki, etc.

name: Tarai Dalit
description: Chamar, Musahar, Dom, Dusadh, Halkhor, etc.

name: Upper Newar
description: Shrestha, Vajracharya, Shakya, Tuladhar, etc.

name: Jyapu/Maharjan
description: Traditional farmer caste, most numerous among Newars

name: Lower Newar
description: Occupational castes like Kasai, Nau, etc.

name: Muslim
description: All Muslim communities (no further caste subdivision typically used)

name: Marwadi/Bania
description: Business communities from Rajasthan region

name: Punjabi/Sikh
description: Punjabi-origin communities

name: Bengali
description: Bengali-speaking minority

name: Tharu
description: Major Tarai indigenous group, often treated separately in policies

name: Magar
description: Largest Hill Janajati group

name: Gurung/Tamang
description: Common Gurkha-origin hill groups

name: Tarai Muslim
description: Majority of Nepali Muslims
